          ▼\n         SiYuan MCP\n```\n\n**Concept Extractor Output:**\n```yaml\n- concept: \"emotion regulation as skill vs trait\"\n  type: tension\n  confidence: high\n  context: \"discussion about       "content": "\"\"\"\nText extraction from PDF and EPUB files.\n\"\"\"\n\nimport re\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom typing import Iterator\n\nimport fitz  # pymupdf\nimport ebooklib\nfrom ebooklib import epub\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass Section:\n    \"\"\"A section of extracted text with metadata.\"\"\"\n    title: str\n    content: str\n    source_file: str\n    chapter: str | None = None\n    page_start: int | None = None\n    page_end: int | None = None\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass ExtractedDocument:\n    \"\"\"Full extracted document with sections.\"\"\"\n    title: str\n    author: str | None\n    source_path: str\n    sections: list[Section]\n\n    @property\n    def full_text(self) -> str:\n        return \"\\n\\n\".join(s.content for s in self.sections)\n\n\ndef extract_pdf(path: Path) -> ExtractedDocument:\n    \"\"\"Extract text from PDF with structure preservation.\"\"\"\n    doc = fitz.open(path)\n\n    # Get metadata\n    metadata = doc.metadata\n    title = metadata.get(\"title\") or path.stem\n    author = metadata.get(\"author\")\n\n    sections = []\n    current_section = None\n    current_content = []\n    current_page_start = 0\n\n    for page_num, page in enumerate(doc):\n        text = page.get_text(\"text\")\n\n        # Simple heuristic: detect chapter/section headers\n        # (lines that are short, possibly numbered, followed by content)\n        lines = text.split(\"\\n\")\n\n        for line in lines:\n            line = line.strip()\n            if not line:\n                continue\n\n            # Detect potential headers (customize based on book structure)\n            is_header = (\n                len(line) < 100 and\n                (line.isupper() or\n                 re.match(r'^(Chapter|CHAPTER|Part|PART|\\d+\\.|\\d+\\s)', line) or\n                 re.match(r'^[IVX]+\\.?\\s', line))  # Roman numerals\n            )\n\n            if is_header and current_content:\n                # Save previous section\n                sections.append(Section(\n                    title=current_section or \"Introduction\",\n                    content=\"\\n\".join(current_content),\n                    source_file=str(path),\n                    chapter=current_section,\n                    page_start=current_page_start,\n                    page_end=page_num\n                ))\n                current_content = []\n                current_section = line\n                current_page_start = page_num\n            else:\n                current_content.append(line)\n\n    # Don't forget last section\n    if current_content:\n        sections.append(Section(\n            title=current_section or \"Content\",\n            content=\"\\n\".join(current_content),\n            source_file=str(path),\n            chapter=current_section,\n            page_start=current_page_start,\n            page_end=len(doc) - 1\n        ))\n\n    doc.close()\n\n    return ExtractedDocument(\n        title=title,\n        author=author,\n        source_path=str(path),\n        sections=sections\n    )\n\n\ndef extract_epub(path: Path) -> ExtractedDocument:\n    \"\"\"Extract text from EPUB with chapter structure.\"\"\"\n    book = epub.read_epub(str(path))\n\n    # Get metadata\n    title = book.get_metadata(\"DC\", \"title\")\n    title = title[0][0] if title else path.stem\n\n    author = book.get_metadata(\"DC\", \"creator\")\n    author = author[0][0] if author else None\n\n    sections = []\n\n    for item in book.get_items():\n        if item.get_type() == ebooklib.ITEM_DOCUMENT:\n            # Parse HTML content\n            soup = BeautifulSoup(item.get_content(), \"html.parser\")\n\n            # Try to find chapter title\n            chapter_title = None\n            for tag in [\"h1\", \"h2\", \"h3\", \"title\"]:\n                header = soup.find(tag)\n                if header:\n                    chapter_title = header.get_text().strip()\n                    break\n\n            # Get text content\n            text = soup.get_text(separator=\"\\n\", strip=True)\n\n            if text.strip():\n                sections.append(Section(\n                    title=chapter_title or item.get_name(),\n                    content=text,\n                    source_file=str(path),\n                    chapter=chapter_title\n                ))\n\n    return ExtractedDocument(\n        title=title,\n        author=author,\n        source_path=str(path),\n        sections=sections\n    )\n\n\ndef extract_document(path: Path) -> ExtractedDocument:\n    \"\"\"Extract document based on file type.\"\"\"\n    suffix = path.suffix.lower()\n\n    if suffix == \".pdf\":\n        return extract_pdf(path)\n    elif suffix == \".epub\":\n        return extract_epub(path)\n    else:\n        raise ValueError(f\"Unsupported file type: {suffix}\")\n\n\ndef extract_all(directory: Path) -> Iterator[ExtractedDocument]:\n    \"\"\"Extract all documents from a directory.\"\"\"\n    for path in directory.iterdir():\n        if path.suffix.lower() in [\".pdf\", \".epub\"]:\n            try:\n                yield extract_document(path)\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"Error extracting {path}: {e}\")\n"

    "text": "## Section 4: SiYuan Integration & Tagging System\n\n**Note Structure in SiYuan:**\n\n```\n/Therapy Framework/\n├── 1-Human Mind/\n│   ├── Emotion Regulation/\n│   │   ├── 📄 emotion-regulation.md        ← Concept note\n│   │   ├── 📄 gross-process-model.md       ← Theory note\n│   │   └── 📚 evidence/                    ← Evidence folder\n│   │       ├── gross-ch3-summary.md\n│   │       └── barkley-ef-er-link.md\n│   └── ...\n├── _Evidence/                              ← Cross-referenced sources\n│   ├── books/\n│   │   └── handbook-emotion-regulation.md  ← Book index note\n│   └── papers/\n│       └── arxiv-2301-xxxxx.md\n├── _Explore/                               ← Tagged for conversation\n│   └── (aliases/refs to tagged items)\n└── _Sessions/\n    └── 2024-11-30-session.md\n```\n\n**Tagging System via SiYuan Attributes:**\n\n```yaml\n# On any block or note:\ncustom-attrs:\n  explore: true           # ← Flag for next session\n  explore-mode: \"deep\"    # deep | question | challenge\n  explore-prompt: \"How does this fit with Barkley's model?\"\n  confidence: \"low\"       # How settled this concept is\n  evidence-strength: \"moderate\"\n  last-enriched: \"2024-11-30\"\n```\n\n**How tagging works:**\n\n1. **During enrichment** - AI auto-tags low-confidence items or gaps\n2. **Manual** - You add `#explore` tag or set attribute in SiYuan\n3. **Session start** - Query SiYuan for `explore: true` → pull into context\n4. **After exploration** - Update confidence, remove tag or mark resolved\n\n**Explore modes:**\n- `deep` - \"Tell me everything the library knows about this\"\n- `question` - \"I have a specific question about this\"\n- `challenge` - \"Stress test this idea\"\n- `connect` - \"How does this relate to X?\"\n\n**Session handoff query:**\n```sql\nSELECT * FROM blocks \nWHERE custom-attrs.explore = true\nORDER BY custom-attrs.confidence ASC\n```\n\n---\n\nDoes this tagging/integration approach work for how you'd want to interact with it?"

Add authors\n                    for author in context.get(\"authors\", []):\n                        if author.get(\"author\"):\n                            supporting_authors.append(author[\"author\"])\n\n            enhanced_results.append(SearchResult(\n                content=vr[\"content\"],\n                score=vr[\"score\"],\n                source_file=vr[\"metadata\"].get(\"source_file\", \"\"),\n                chapter=vr[\"metadata\"].get(\"chapter\"),\n                related_concepts=list(set(related_concepts)),\n                supporting_authors=list(set(supporting_authors))\n            ))\n\n        #
